name: GTFS
description: (General Transit Feed Specification) Provides information about public transport schedules.  Github: https://github.com/jenglert/node-gtfs

agency.description: Represents the business unit that operates this service.

calendar.description: Represents different time frames that have different schedules.

fields.name: id
fields.description: Text key uniquely identifying the time frame (SAt, SUN, WKDY, etc...).

fields.name: type
fields.description: 0 - tram/lightrail, 1 - subway, 2 - rail, 3 - bus, 4 - ferry, 5 - cable car, 6 - gondola, 7 - funicular

stop.description: Represnets a stop (you know, where you can like get of and like get on).

stop_time.description: Represents a stop on a particular trip.

fields.name: arrival_time
fields.description: The time that the vehicle arrives at the station.

fields.name: departure_time
fields.description: The time that the vehicle leaves the station.  Often the same as the arrival time indicating it's a quick stop.

fields.name: sequence
fields.description: The order of the stop for this particular trip.

trip.description: The path the vehicle takes stopping for people along the way (unless it's full of course.  Then it might just keep going.  You never know.)

fields.name: direction
fields.description: Sorta silly because it's make an assumption about where the 'center' is but: 1 - outbound, 2 - inbound

planned_trip.description: A trip as planned for a particular user.  Effectiveliy, a set of steps to get from stop A to stop B.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of records to return

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Used to paginate. First page of results is 0.

operations.description: Search all services. Results are always paginated.

parameters.name: trip_id
parameters.description: The id of the trip you are looking for stop times for.

operations.description: Finds a trip by route, direction and calendar.
Attempts to find a trip from the two specified stops.  Returns 0 or more planned trips. Returns 0 if a possible trip does not exist.

parameters.name: departure_date_time
parameters.description: Defaults to right now if not provided.
